intro: Seriola incana, commonly known as the silver horse mackerel, is a marine fish species belonging to the family Scombridae. It is characterized by its slender body, silvery scales, and a distinctive pattern of dark stripes along its sides. Native to the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans, it typically inhabits coastal waters and is often found near the surface.
